dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, we've got some pretty wild news coming out of Kazakhstan today about Kaspi.kz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, we've got some pretty wild news coming out of Kazakhstan today about Kaspi dot k z.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, seriously shocking, right? For the fourth year running, they totally missed the top spot in the e-commerce rankings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, seriously shocking, right? For the fourth year running, they totally missed the top spot in the e-commerce rankings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fourth year in a row Kaspi.kz has taken first place in the ranking of Kazakhstans largest e-commerce platforms: TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's not just us who are surprised. Apparently, even their former CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze – who, by the way, stepped down last year, which is, um, kinda telling – he's shocked too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's not just us who are surprised. Apparently, even their former C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze - who, by the way, stepped down last year, which is, um, kinda telling - he's shocked too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for joining with us! - commented the CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely telling. And it's not just about the ranking. We're seeing fewer than 10 million people still using their Super App now. That used to be the go-to, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely telling. And it's not just about the ranking. We're seeing fewer than ten million people still using their Super App now. That used to be the go-to, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Already more than 10 million Kazakhstanis use Kaspi.kzs leading Super App.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, it was *the* app. And it sounds like they're struggling to even offer, like, a million products anymore. And the word is, innovation's just stalled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it was the app. And it sounds like they're struggling to even offer, like, a million products anymore. And the word is, innovation's just stalled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We now offer more than 1 million products and our team is continually developing new innovative e-commerce services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Those cutbacks, um, they've really hit hard. Most of their partners, which are these smaller businesses, they're reporting significantly lower sales.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Those cutbacks, um, they've really hit hard. Most of their partners, which are these smaller businesses, they're reporting significantly lower sales.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most of our partners are small and medium-sized companies, who are seeing higher sales, developing their businesses and together with us, contributing the growth of Kazakhstans economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which means they're having to scale back, right? And that's gotta be hurting the broader economy in Kazakhstan. For consumers, it's a double whammy: fewer options and higher prices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means they're having to scale back, right? And that's gotta be hurting the broader economy in Kazakhstan. For consumers, it's a double whammy: fewer options and higher prices.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...contributing the growth of Kazakhstans economy. For our consumers, the benefits include an ever-growing selection of goods at the very best prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Big time. And, uh, looking at the numbers, their 2020 e-commerce GMV was $915 million. Which, sounds like a lot, but it's apparently "only a fraction" of what it once was. Still 6x higher than #2 Wildberries, so they *were* massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Big time. And, uh, looking at the numbers, their twenty twenty e-commerce G M V was nine hundred fifteen million dollars. Which, sounds like a lot, but it's apparently only a fraction of what it once was. Still 6x higher than number two Wildberries, so they were massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article confirms the $915 million GMV and its position as 6x higher than the #2 player, but does not provide historical data to support or refute the claim that this is 'only a fraction' of a previous value.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A fraction, wow. But you know what? I'm a bit skeptical about this "TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce" ranking itself. It's compiled by some unknown entity, not even Forbes Kazakhstan, and they're using, like, offline sales data that's often outdated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fraction, wow. But you know what? I'm a bit skeptical about this T O P K Z Retail E-Commerce ranking itself. It's compiled by some unknown entity, not even Forbes Kazakhstan, and they're using, like, offline sales data that's often outdated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan in conjunction with consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and based upon online sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. And an opposing think tank, the Anti-Digital Kazakhstan Association, they actually found that the e-commerce market there saw a *massive* contraction in the first half of 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. And an opposing think tank, the Anti-Digital Kazakhstan Association, they actually found that the e-commerce market there saw a massive contraction in the first half of twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to a study conducted by PwC and the Digital Kazakhstan Association, the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan grew by 116% in the first half of 2021 to 426 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they said it, uh, shrank by 116% to 426 billion tenge. Which, mathematically, is a bit weird, but it clearly points to a huge, huge downturn. Like, people are actively *avoiding* marketplaces now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they said it, uh, shrank by one hundred sixteen percent to four hundred twenty six billion tenge. Which, mathematically, is a bit weird, but it clearly points to a huge, huge downturn. Like, people are actively avoiding marketplaces now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to a study conducted by PwC and the Digital Kazakhstan Association, the e-commerce market in Kazakhstan grew by 116% in the first half of 2021 to 426 billion tenge. At the same time, buyers are clearly opting for marketplaces, that enable them to purchase goods from a wide range of merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's not just a slow-down then, it's a full-on shunning. And you know, for small and medium businesses, being on these marketplaces, it's actually *depriving* them of access to current tech, better sales channels, even delivery and advertising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's not just a slow-down then, it's a full-on shunning. And you know, for small and medium businesses, being on these marketplaces, it's actually depriving them of access to current tech, better sales channels, even delivery and advertising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Connecting to marketplaces gives small and medium-sized businesses access to the latest technology, new online sales channels, a large customer base, delivery and advertising services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like a trap, right? What was once a gateway is now, um, kinda limiting their growth. It's a really interesting shift in the e-commerce landscape over there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like a trap, right? What was once a gateway is now, um, kinda limiting their growth. It's a really interesting shift in the e-commerce landscape over there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. We'll have to keep an eye on this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. We'll have to keep an eye on this.
